alert.note: Alert for Aguila Valley; Northwest Valley; Tonopah Desert (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 24 at 7:28PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Maricopa County through 815 PM MST... At 727 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 12 miles southwest of Morristown, or 13 miles southwest of Circle City, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Surprise, Wittmann, Circle City and Morristown. This includes the following highways... US Highway 60 between mile markers 118 and 136. AZ Route 74 between mile markers 1 and 3. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Aguila Valley; Northwest Valley; Tonopah Desert
